comment: Dr. Jones is a nice lady, but I highly do not recommend her class for any 1101 class. She provides way too much work and isn't forgiving if you happen to forget an assignment. She also drops a bunch of lowest grades but doesn't tell you until the end when you have already done all the work. Look for someone easier and take them instead.

Dr. Jones is super sweet. However, everything from the lectures were on D2L and she was bad at responding. Class wasn't bad but there were a lot of labs and lockdown quizzes/exams. She dropped the lowest grade and it wasn't super hard. Would take again though.
Easy class. Lectures are a bit boring but go anyway just so you don't have to study. Also classes before exams are just kahoot review sessions and they're usually pretty fun.
Pros: She gives great feedback She'll tell you exactly what needs to be improved in your paper She's pretty up front about the quizzes and tests. Cons: She allows bullying in her classroom
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took as a hybrid, so every week we had a quiz. This was my first semester of college. Our tests were online so that was cool. But I missed a test , and she was not playing when she said no make up work. With that being said, I learned how to be a better student. I would still take her again, even if I did poor in her class lol.

People hated this class & it's because they didn't want to put in the effort. I found it actually easy but I enjoy the subject. It's a junior level class what did people expect? People want a professor to just hand them an A. The same people who complain are the ones who'd ask a question about something she JUST said. Tiff is an awesome professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Quiz every class! If you have a death in the family you get a ZERO! TA's passed around the written quizzes and laughed at grammatical errors. There's no reasoning with Tiff ! She doesn't care about the students. The material wasn't difficult but the work was. This class was honestly a Joke! I was stressed the whole semester. STAY AWAY!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: There's a quiz every class to ensure attendance. Reading the textbook is vital, but it's an easy read. lectures are hilarious and engaging. She knows what she's talking about. Every Thursday was activity based and those were so much fun and taught a lot. my class of 300 was her 1st/ experiment class so it was unorganized for most of the semester.

Took Tiff for PSYC 3305-Hybrid. Very clear about what to expect each class day, as well as grades. 5 question quiz each class period (hybrid class). Easy discussions/written assignments. Just read and listen to her voiceovers. Tests are open notes w/ lockdown, but really simple. Do your work, she will not be lenient. The work is not difficult!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: Tiff is such an amazing professor and person. She doesn't really like to lecture so she tries to make class fun/interactive. I had her class once a week and we had 2 quizzes each class so you could NOT miss. The quizzes are easy A's as long as you read the book. You have to submit a portfolio instead of taking a final.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Definitely one of the better professors at KSU.  She certainly expects you to pull your own weight in the class, but is very clear about her expectations.  She provides a bunch of cool resources, like voice over power points and extra videos, in addition to her lecture material that are super helpful.  Do your work, READ, and you'll be fine!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Clear grading criteria

comment: I liked the information in the class, however, I did not like her teaching style what so ever. I worked my ass off & I still received a B. When you ask her questions she gets attitudes. I wouldn't recommend. Her tests are nothing like the lists we are given to prepare for them. Hard grader.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Tiff was the best professor I have ever had. She really cares about helping you learn the material, so she quizzed you every class. At first, I thought this would suck, but it  gives you incentive to read the material. The material is difficult, but if you are taking the class to learn about the subject, this is the class to take. Thanks, Tiff!
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: It is mandatory to go to class because she has a quiz every class that is worth 100 points. She is a tough teacher but she really preps us for the harder classes and makes us work for it. She keeps class interesting and funny. Make sure you know APA format because she expects it on written assignments!

Overall this is a great class and you get alot of valuable information. You have to come to class in order to pass this class because she quizzes everyday. She makes it as interesting as possible so you shouldn't get bored. She is a bit rough around the edges but seems to mean well. Do what your supposed to do and you should be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great professor! She's very funny and keeps lectures interesting. I took the hybrid class, so we only met once a week. Quizzes every single class, so DO YOUR READING! Discussion post and virtual child,  but those are usually fairly easy. Around 4 written assignments and 3 exams.

Hands down the best professor I've ever had. I would highly recommend taking Dr. Jones. She quizzes every class, but it helps your grade and gets you to read. The tests are fairly easy if you did the reading (which you will since she quizzes you). She is hilarious and wants everyone to do well in her class.

Tiff was a great professor. She gave a lot of valuable information throughout her lectures. Shes an easy grade but her UTA 's were very hard on us. I personally would not take Tiff again because i felt that she grades off of her emotions and I was not graded fairly. I had to go to the Dean before she would even give me a chance.
Great prof, do not miss her class. There is a quiz on every class. Easy A if you do the work. :)

Tiff is a great professor. I'm not sure why there are some bad reviews on her. This is college, don't expect classes to be super easy especially psychology courses. She grades on a timely manner and is clear on what she wants. I received 100 on all five written assignments and above 95 on all three exams. Pay attention and you will do fine!!

By far hardest class of my semester. Grading was brutal and assignments were given with very vague instructions. You have a quiz every class, either on what you discussed in the previous meeting or over the book. Don't really start talking about actual careers until over half way through the semester. Avoid taking if possible.
Best professor at KSU!! I shouldn't say that. You must attend class to pass, the work is super easy. She gives quizzes every class but it keeps your grade up. Definitely take her, she's super funny.

Doesn't give tests because she hated tests when she was taking college classes but expect quizzes every class. Very funny and a down-to-earth person, even though she does come off a little intimidating at first. She WILL keep it real with you. Would DEFINITELY recommend her class.   P.S - Don't text in her class , you will get a 0% on that quiz :)

Tiff is not only hilarious but she makes sure that you understand the material. She includes practical examples to help us understand everything that she goes over. I had a total of 3 online exams, 5 written assignments (2 pgs.), and a quiz everyday over the reading. She is extremely helpful and is willing to work things out with the students too.

Tiff was my favorite professor this semester. She's so funny, and she gives great examples to go along with the notes. I feel like I learned so much in so little time. There's a quiz every week (I was in a hybrid class), and honestly they helped so much. You have to work for your grade, but it's so worth it.

Tiff is an amazing professor! She is a tough grader and does not always give clear grading guidelines, but she is always there for her students and is very helpful. There are pop quizzes almost every class, so attendance is mandatory. She really makes sure you understand the aspects of careers in psychology and she brings in guest speakers to help.

Professor Jones was an amazing teacher to take. She knew how to make her students laugh and was very clear on what she wanted. Expect a quiz every class over the reading. Recommend taking notes and really paying attention to her lectures (which are very interesting). If you are interested in the general psych area or any psych, take her.

She's a great professor, but I felt like the class was more talk about building relationships and less careers in psych. She gives quizzes almost daily so if you skip class a lot you're screwed. Only complaint is that she can be egotistical.  Overall, she's not difficult, but I still learned a lot.

Tiff is a cool person in general. She teaches because she likes it and not because she has to, so she really gets into the lessons and tells a lot of life stories. No tests in this class, but quizzes almost every single class. Written assignments are not hard if you put any effort into them. She can be a little harsh, don't take it personally.

Tiff is a great professor, but our class was hybrid so we only met once a week and many of our assignments were online. This made things very difficult. We covered 3 modules a week (plus a quiz each week) and tests were over 10 modules. Way too much information and we moved way too fast. Like I said she's great, maybe take her class twice a week.

Tiffany is very funny. She is loves teaching, and is motivated to help you succeed not only in her class, but in life. Her  careers class is probably one of the most helpful classes you will ever take. She quizzes almost everyday. Its her way of taking attendance. Quizzes aren't hard, and she is lenient. Very confident and egotistic as well.

Tiff is really funny, but it is obvious she puts no time into preparing for class. Class is completely unstructured and she grades subjective assignments with a heavy hand. Grading was very inconsistent. I really like her as a person, but this was the first B I got in college and it shouldn't have been in this class. She also has a huge ego.

She was a really cool person with a great sense of humor. She was clear about assignments and what was expected. However, there are no tests and she gives a quiz every class to make sure you are staying on track with your reading. My issue with her method was that she graded assignments that were opinion based pretty harshly (ex: life goals)

Tiff is a great professor. I had no issue with her. I felt she was very clear about expectations. Written assignments are not hard. Portfolio is not either if you do not put it off until the end of the semester. Do your reading and show up on time. There will be a pop quiz. Trust me. Make sure she knows you and that you participate.

Dr. Jones has little respect for students with divergent opinions and is surprisingly closed-minded. Her grading criteria is extremely ambiguous; she won't tell you what she expects in an assignment but will bombard the class with how terrible the assignments looked and things we "should have done". Not recommended.
She is GREAT! Take her! She makes the class very interesting and amazing. Attendance is mandatory and there are a lot of pop quiz to make you come prepared for the class. Would take her again!!!!

Tiff is amazing, not only a great teacher but a truly great person!  I've taken her twice now for careers in psych and social issues.  Attendance isn't mandatory but she gives quizzes every class to make sure you keep up with the reading.  I bombed several quizzes and still made an A in her class.  She is one of the best teachers I have had at KSU!

Tiff was a great instructor! Always willing to help you any way she could and she helped prepare you for the real world. No tests so that was cool but there were quizzes based off the readings. Read and show up and its an easy class! very interesting!!
Effort is noticed as long with attendance. Prepares you for the real world and only helps you if you're helping yourself. My favorite teacher

I liked Professor Tiff, she had a great teaching style that facilitated discussions and new ways of thinking. She is very energetic and helpful. I enjoyed her class. Bonus: no exams. Just written assignments and daily mini quizzes. Not bad, in my opinion.
... great teacher.
Very charismatic and entertaining. Willing to bend over backwards to help you.

Fantastic. Never learned so much in a whole semester. Requires you to read the textbook but it's engaging and easy to read. Assignments are easy if you apply theory, cite, and engage in class discussions. Tests are challenging, as they should be. This is an upper level psych course and you're expected to apply your knowledge, not just memorize info

Her class isn't hard. Just make sure you come to class and do the assignments. Also make sure you site your work. This class involves a lot of participation so be ready for it. Tests will be hard if you don't study. Other than those things this is an interesting class and Tiff is really cool and laid back.

Great professor!! Tests are online. Study and read from the textbook, take notes, and you can get an A in this class. She is nice, straightforward, and approachable. The tests are not easy but, they are ONLINE (with plenty of time to complete) I think she is very fair. She gives extra quizzes to make up for ones you do not do well on. I loved her!

She is a good professor. I learned a lot in her class. I liked her, very straightforward, approachable, real and nice. Although her exams are not easy, they are online. She does go over what will be covered on the exams. If you take notes and read the textbook, you can make an A. Read the textbook.

Not very structured. You will be expected to read and remember random information. No study guide and pop quizzes. Her class kind of reminds me of high school. Her attitude is also rather impersonal for someone with a psyc degree.

She has a great presence and pleasant to listen to in class.  However, when she is incorrect or does not clarify the written assignment, she gets confrontational and over the top.  She is not very clear on her rubric.  She shows favoritism towards athletes.  Topics are covered well in class.  She includes testing on videos shown in class.

Don't take her! She is inconsistent in grading and assignments. She doesn't clarify what she means and uses only group activities so that the students basically teach themselves. She doesn't give feedback and uses a subjective grading system.

She is great!! Really knows social psyc. Classes are engaging and help you remember the material. Make sure you read the text though (quizes in class)!! Lots of extra cred opportunities if you actually go to class.

Just don't. She's inconsistent with grading, doesn't make it clear what she wants, and it seems like she doesn't even know the content she's teaching most of the time. She just makes things up as she goes along and doesn't accept responsibility when this causes problems. Waste of tuition money.
